intro: Oenothera parryi f. tenuissima, commonly known as the narrowleaf evening primrose, is a flowering plant native to the southwestern United States. It is a member of the Onagraceae family and is characterized by its slender, upright stems and showy yellow to orange flowers that open in the evening. The plant produces capsule fruits that contain numerous small, oily seeds. It thrives in dry, sandy soils and is adapted to arid environments. Oenothera parryi f. tenuissima is known for its ecological importance as a food source for nocturnal pollinators.
